bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to [s.n.] Abbott, November 22, 1921

div1.p: Carter makes a donation to Newfoundland fishermen. He refers to difficulties in transportation and distribution to help Russian children.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to [s.n.] Abbott, November 22, 1921
div1.opener:
Miscl.
Newfoundland
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
November 22, 1921.
tt,
,
Avenue,
, N. Y.
Abbott:
div1.p:
you kindly endorse the enclosed check for $20.00 to
Sir Wilfred Grenville--or whosoever else is proper--for the benefit
of the Newfoundland fishermen? I take this method rather than for-
warding it to the Rev. Frederick Lynch, D. D. (Outlook, Nov. 16th.
Pages 442-3) because I wish the Newfoundland fishermen to get 100%
benefit from this small contribution rather than just a percentage
on selling their fish for the benefit of the Russian children (to
which charity I have already subscribed) the more so as I under-
stand that it is not the lack of money that is handicapping the
latter work, but difficulties of transportation and distribution.

With all good wishes for yourself and the Outlook--to both
of whom I have been often grateful for information as to where to
give where the need was greatest and for the assurance that through
you that need would be safely and promptly reached.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
Enclosure.
